presenter.bio: How to become an EUS expert

slide.title: How to become an EUS expert
slide.titleNormalized: how to become an eus expert
slide.notes: Ladies and gentlemen, good afternoon. First of all I would like to express my hearty appreciation to the organizing committee and the prof Seo to invite me to attend this meeting. So I devote myself to prepare this topic well. I think it’s better for me to present in a different way.

So I devote myself to prepare this topic well. I think it’s better for me to present in a different way.
slide.text: How to become an EUS expert September 18, 2016 1 2016/09/09-10 Asan Medical Center, Seoul, Korea Asian EUS summit 2016 Jiann–Hwa Chen, M.D. Taipei Tzu Chi Hospital Tzu Chi University School of Medicine

slide.title: PROCtor
slide.notes: Proctor can be translated as surrogate or substitute, means teacher can train you as smart as he （observation）、實作練習（practice）、反思（reflection）及師傅之教導（coaching） Proctor – Surrogate or substitute

slide.text: The way I learn EUS – 4 T Strategy September 18, 2016 4 Text Teachers Training Treatment (practice)

slide.title: Textbook - Knowledge
slide.notes: The importance of reading books relies not on how many books you have read but on that you can accomplish reading the entire book

slide.text:
Textbook - Knowledge Techniques learning – the first step is always studying from the textbook, paper or literature
September 18, 2016 5

slide.text: Teachers - Mentor September 18, 2016 6 Last edited by DenqoroWoyane Ben Pollard from Bristol, CT Like father, like son

slide.title: Training
slide.text:
Training Learning under supervision Never do harm to patients Attend the hands-on training course
September 18, 2016 11

slide.title: Practice
slide.text:
Practice Perform abdominal ultrasonography by yourself Ex vivo EUS scanning Multi-disciplinary discussion
September 18, 2016 14

slide.title: Abdominal ultrasonography
slide.notes: In Taiwan, we perform abdominal ultrasound by ourselves
slide.notesNormalized: in taiwan, we perform abdominal ultrasound by ourselves
slide.notesHtml: In Taiwan, we perform abdominal ultrasound by ourselves
slide.text:
Abdominal ultrasonography Abdominal US can delineate the whole picture of organ and the EUS reveals the detail part. A good follow-up modality
September 18, 2016 15

slide.text: Endoscopic ultrasonography Compared with CT image 2016/9/18 18 EUS

slide.title: Ex vivo EUS scanning
slide.text: Ex vivo EUS scanning EUS study of resected surgical specimen Compare with that of in vivo exam Refer to the histopathologic finding September 18, 2016 22

slide.title: Multi-disciplinary discussion
slide.text:
Multi-disciplinary discussion Discuss with radiologist, surgeon and pathologist Periodic combined meeting
September 18, 2016 23

slide.title: September 18, 2016
slide.notes: It is always associated with your attitude or dedication. You should be ambitious. I would imagine the "I suck" threshold would be the very bottom of a scale (like "1" on a scale of 1 to 10) and the "I kick ass" would be the very top (10). I would imagine that someone who had never played a particular video game before and who had no innate skill would "suck", while someone else who had spent most of his waking hours playing the game non-stop for years and reached a very high level of proficiency would "kick ass". Kick-ass can sometimes be used as an adjective This is a really kick-ass product
slide.notesNormalized: it is always associated with your attitude or dedication. you should be ambitious. i would imagine the "i suck" threshold would be the very bottom of a scale (like "1" on a scale of 1 to 10) and the "i kick ass" would be the very top (10). i would imagine that someone who had never played a particular video game before and who had no innate skill would "suck", while someone else who had spent most of his waking hours playing the game non-stop for years and reached a very high level of proficiency would "kick ass". kick-ass can sometimes be used as an adjective this is a really kick-ass product
slide.notesHtml:
It is always associated with your attitude or dedication. You should be ambitious.

I would imagine the "I suck" threshold would be the very bottom of a scale (like "1" on a scale of 1 to 10) and the "I kick ass" would be the very top (10). I would imagine that someone who had never played a particular video game before and who had no innate skill would "suck", while someone else who had spent most of his waking hours playing the game non-stop for years and reached a very high level of proficiency would "kick ass". Kick-ass can sometimes be used as an adjective This is a really kick-ass product

slide.title: Practice makes perfect
slide.notes: As you know, any technique just like riding bicycle, via continuous and persevere practicing you can become an expert, we hope.
slide.notesNormalized: as you know, any technique just like riding bicycle, via continuous and persevere practicing you can become an expert, we hope.
slide.notesHtml: As you know, any technique just like riding bicycle, via continuous and persevere practicing you can become an expert, we hope.
slide.text: Practice makes perfect September 18, 2016 25 From daily Mail online

slide.title: Clinical application of different EUS models
slide.titleNormalized: clinical application of different eus models
slide.text:
Clinical application of different EUS models Radial scan model -- Imaging diagnosis by circular pictures (1)vertical to scope (2) malignancy staging (3) SMT evaluation
Linear scan model by sector-- image parallel to scope (1) longitudinal to scope (2) EUS guided FNA (diagnostic and therapeutic uses: biopsy, drainage, injection) September 18, 2016 28

slide.title: General concept (I)
slide.text: General concept (I) EUS is an imaging diagnostic tool. EUS is the combined tool with endoscope and ultrasound. The EUS scope is different from standard endoscope and probe is not same with catheter. Radial EUS and Curved Linear Array (CLA) EUS are similar but have their own view‐point. EUS intervention is performed based on imaging. September 18, 2016 30

slide.title: General concept (II)
slide.text: General concept (II) Good images can lead to the correct diagnosis and good results of intervention. Realizing the character of EUS endoscopes, probes and monitor Clinical evaluation: useful or valuable Image quality: Good or not Images: Understandable or not September 18, 2016 31

slide.title: demonstrate and record high quality images
slide.titleNormalized: demonstrate and record high quality images
slide.text: demonstrate and record high quality images Control and decide the best condition of monitor unit on gain and contrast (not too bright or black, not too strong, color of background ) Demonstrating understandable images based on the standard image (adequate position in each organ and surrounding organs) and continuous (real time) scanning From wide range to limited range ( 9cm‐6cm‐4cm, from 360 degree to 180 degree images, low frequency to high frequency 4-5-6-7.5-12) Less acoustic area by air in the images Appendix; Focus of scanner (1.5cm to 2.0cm), Continuous scanning (from end to end) September 18, 2016 32

slide.title: Recommended order of scanning is 1-3-2 or 3-2-1
slide.titleNormalized: recommended order of scanning is 1-3-2 or 3-2-1
slide.text: September 18, 2016 34 Recommended order of scanning is 1-3-2 or 3-2-1

slide.title: ② Scanning from the duodenal bulb or the gastric antrum
slide.titleNormalized: ② scanning from the duodenal bulb or the gastric antrum
slide.text: ② Scanning from the duodenal bulb or the gastric antrum September 18, 2016 37 Insert the scope into the duodenal bulb. Inflate the balloon and start scanning while slowly withdrawing the scope.

slide.title: September 18, 2016
slide.text: Pull method – Stretch technique (like ERCP), sometimes water filling is used. observation of the pancreatic head and major papilla Longitudinal method -- Rotate the up/down knob in the ‘‘up’’ direction and perform scanning while withdrawing the scope. Transverse method -- Adjust the ‘‘up/down’’ and ‘‘right/left’’ knobs to obtain a cross- sectional view of the aorta. Push method -- Pull the scope back to the gastric antrum. Then, reinsert the scope into the duodenal bulb. September 18, 2016 40

slide.title: Tips in practice
slide.text: Tips in practice Do not inflate too much air Injecting small mount of water into the GI lumen after inflating the balloon Put the targets at the preferable positions and rotate the scope meticulously Slow manipulation of scope Avoid too much torque of the scope September 18, 2016 43

slide.title: Take home message
slide.text: Take home message There is no shot cut to be an EUS expert Learning curve is steep, so dedication and perseverance are needed. It is important to demonstrate the character of the lesions and to record the images which everybody can understand. Making the good images means the good diagnosis and safety intervention. September 18, 2016 44

slide.title: Thanks for your kind attention
slide.text: Thanks for your kind attention September 18, 2016 45 Taipei Tzu Chi Hospital
